programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: When three people are found dead on the same day in a Kentucky town, investigators know it isn't a coincidence; years pass before there's an arrest as the case continues to divide the community.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man disappears one year to the day after beginning an affair with his friend's wife. 15 years later, with the help of a metal detector, police found evidence which would prove what had happened, and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a mail-order bride proves suspicious when detectives learn that two of the Texas husband's previous wives had died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A serial arsonist was on the loose in Washington, DC. Each of the fires was started with the same type of incendiary device. It was up to forensic scientists to find the clues that lay in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a wealthy real estate tycoon went missing, it appeared to be foul play. In his will, he left instructions regarding what was to happen if he died under violent circumstances_which were carried out after a hiker came across a bullet-ridden skull.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of an Air Force officer was found dead in her bed with a plastic laundry bag near her face. Further investigation proved that the scene had been staged. Her death wasn't an accident; it was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: California police had several suspects in the robbery and brutal murder of an elderly couple. Ten years later, a determined forensic scientist used material from a dentist's office to uncover ballistic evidence which had been overlooked.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two men were murdered while sleeping in their beds. The next night, arson destroyed a family planning clinic. Investigators wonder whether some shards of glass, paint chips and a chicken feather could link what appeared to be two separate crimes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1986, Kathleen Lipscomb's body was found on a deserted road outside of San Antonio. Months passed, then years, and the crime was never solved. Then Kathleen's family hired a private investigator, who discovered her diary.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women from the same town were murdered in the same way, police feared a serial killer was on the loose. At first they thought the victims had nothing in common until they found tiny clues linking them to the same man.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For years, a woman suffered from what appeared to be the unpleasant side effects of lithium, a drug prescribed to treat bipolar disorder. When she died, investigators had to determine if her death was due to natural causes, suicide, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a fire destroyed most of a home and a young boy went missing, police organized the largest search in the history of their small town. First the boy's backpack was discovered five miles from home, and then his body was found 50 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman was killed instantly when a bomb exploded in her home. The device was so powerful that shrapnel was embedded in houses across the street. The bomber had not only knowledge and skill, but also a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of an eccentric millionaire was not entirely unexpected; he flaunted his wealth and cared little for personal security. The evidence at the crime seemed to indicate robbery, but investigators wondered if there was something more.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: At a murder scene, investigators find a shoe-print, several foreign hairs, and unknown fingerprints. But they believe the most telling piece of evidence is the bite mark on the victim's chest.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Relates the story of Paul Kenneth Keller, a serial arsonist responsible for several fires that caused millions of dollars worth of property damage and the deaths of three people. More than 75 Seattle-area arsons are probed before he was discovered, partly through the use of forensic hypnosis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular disc jockey was found murdered in a community garden, police swung into action. A sniffer dog and a blood spatter expert led police to the killer and he'd been much closer than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide _ but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the kidnapping and rape of an 18-year-old Ohio woman is aided when the victim returns hours after the incident occurred. With her help, the police are able to track the assailant Craig Bailey to his front door.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When hunters found a skull in a Texas canyon, police found bits of clothing, small bones and a strand of hair. A forensic artist reconstructed her face. Now all they had to do was find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the first time animal DNA was used to solve a criminal case. When the body of Douglas Beamish's estranged wife Shirley Duguay was discovered, authorities linked 20 cat hairs found on her jacket to a cat owned by Beamish's parents.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Sheila Bryan, who was convicted of killing her mother in a car fire, is granted a new trial. An expert fire witness's opinion on how the fire ignited differs from the prosecution's theory. If verified, it would clear Bryan of any culpability.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 34-year-old nurse experiences a variety of flu-like symptoms. None of her doctors are able to discover the cause, until she visits the gynecologist for a routine check-up. Then she learns it's something far worse than the flu.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, the state of Florida was known for more than just Disney World. Worldwide attention focused on a rash of robberies which targeted tourists. Some vacationers were killed in these attacks, but some fought and survived, despite severe injuries.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isn't usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a man's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who allowed his victim, 17-year-old Shari Smith, to write a last will and testament on a note pad, then informed the family of her murder, as well as the later murder of a 10-year-old Debra May Helmick. A phone number written on a previous page left a lasting impression, which helped to convict Larry Gene Bell.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Investigators sift through the ashes of a fire which killed a 40-year-old woman. The fire appeared to have been started by an unattended cigarette. On closer look, forensic scientists discover the cause was far more complicated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A patrol officer is shocked by the amount of blood at a traffic accident and is shocked by the coroner's ruling until an anonymous phone call re-ignites the case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was 1957, and California police were searching for a man who had committed several crimes in one night, including murder. They followed thousands of leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators proved an old adage: You can run, but you can't hide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was supposed to be a routine motorcade for the Queen of England. But on the way to Yosemite National Park, a car carrying three Secret Service agents collided with a car driven by a deputy from the local sheriff's office.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Colorado hunter who'd been shot three times was the victim of a well planned crime. Investigators suspected two weapons and two killers. But analysis of the forensic evidence pointed them in a different direction--one much closer to home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A neighbor watched as a man stabbed his wife, pushed her into the swimming pool and held her head under water. The husband, however, had no recollection of the crime. A jury would have to decide between evidence and the mysteries of the mind.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An employee of a dry cleaner was raped and murdered in the store. Police turned to forensic science for the answers they needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an elderly couple died in a suspicious house fire, their son became the prime suspect. Investigators turned to forensic science to determine if the fire had been set deliberately, or if it was an unfortunate accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at a trio of unsolved murders that occurred in Wichita Falls, Texas during the 1980s, details how a fourth murder from the same time period provided the police with more than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, when the wife of a serviceman was brutally murdered in the Philippines, investigators had to reassemble a 5-1/4 inch computer disk which had been cut to pieces with pinking shears in order to find the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Modesto, California teenager went missing. There was no sign of a struggle in her home, and police suspected she'd simply run away until her naked, bruised body was discovered in a ditch 20 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The sensitive nose of a forensic examiner sniffs out murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The police investigate when a severed leg is discovered in the garbage. Conventional means of identifying the victim are impossible, leading investigators to rely on DNA, forensic anthropology and toxicology to identify the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two sets of scientists probe a woman's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1996 Seattle murder of suburban couple Raquel Rivera & Jay Johnson is detailed. Evidence from the couple's dog Chief eventually ties one of the murderers to the scene. This is one of the first cases where dog DNA was used to convict.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a wealthy American businessman was found in his rental car. Teeth and bone fragments were the only remains. When the victim's wife files an insurance claim for $7 million, investigators seek the help of a renowned forensic anthropologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a young woman was found under an isolated ramp of the Interstate, and a tiny, unique fiber on the victim's clothing led San Diego police straight to the most unlikely of killers.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Residents of Noel, Missouri were stunned to learn that their bank had been robbed and the bank president was missing. His body was later found floating in a lake, securely bound to a chair with duct tape.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A drive-by shooting leaves one man dead and another seriously wounded. Cell phone calls and shell casings point to a suspect, but authorities are unable to place him at the crime scene. A forensic geologist proves that dirt is anything but dumb.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the 2002 DC area shooting spree that resulted in ten murders.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A murder investigation in St. Petersburg, Florida, crosses jurisdictions from New York and Jamaica. The police rely on cell phone mapping, wiretapping and a host of forensic evidence to link a suspect to a murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is killed while walking her dogs in the woods. Since she had no enemies and her husband has an alibi, police assume it was a hunting accident...until a strange letter turns up allegedly written by the woman before her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For six years, a serial killer prowled the streets of New York City. He wrote letters to police and The New York Post, indicating he would kill twelve people, one for each astrological sign.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Computers aid the police and FBI in solving a string of crimes in St. Louis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Exploring how an American hit single from 1966 -- "The Cheater" by Bob Kuban and the In-Men -- foreshadowed the demise of the group's lead singer, Walter Scott.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a street fight took the life of a national wrestling champion, police had to determine if he was killed in cold blood, or in self-defense. A jury decided it was murder, and sentenced the accused to a minimum of twenty years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Haunted by the disappearance of her mother, a young woman undertook an investigation of her own. Her mother's diary was in the cold case file; there, she discovered a dark family secret, which might have been the reason her mother vanished.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a wealthy American businessman was found in his rental car. Teeth and bone fragments were the only remains. When the victim's wife files an insurance claim for $7 million, investigators seek the help of a renowned forensic anthropologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A behavioral profile caused the Baton Rouge Police Department to search for the wrong man. They might not have made an arrest had it not been for a DNA picture of the suspect painted by a molecular biologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Modesto, California teenager went missing. There was no sign of a struggle in her home, and police suspected she'd simply run away until her naked, bruised body was discovered in a ditch 20 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic scientists work with the only clue recovered from a multiple-victim shooting: a 12-gauge shotgun. Scientists use unique methods to lift the serial number from the weapon in order to trace it to its owner.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1996 Seattle murder of suburban couple Raquel Rivera & Jay Johnson is detailed. Evidence from the couple's dog Chief eventually ties one of the murderers to the scene. This is one of the first cases where dog DNA was used to convict.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A healthy young man dies mysteriously in his sleep, and toxicology tests reveal a lethal dose of lidocaine in his blood. Investigators find a suicide note, and presume he killed himself until a forensic linguist examines the note.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, the Amtrak Railroad experienced the deadliest train crash in United States history when the Sunset Limited derailed while crossing Alabama's Big Bayou Canot bridge. Forty-seven passengers and crew were killed; scores more were injured.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For years, a woman suffered from what appeared to be the unpleasant side effects of lithium, a drug prescribed to treat bipolar disorder. When she died, investigators had to determine if her death was due to natural causes, suicide, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police instituted an intense search when the mother of two young children went missing. Twenty years after finding her body, advances in technology enable investigators to see evidence in a new light, and discover it pointed directly to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 34-year-old nurse experiences a variety of flu-like symptoms. None of her doctors are able to discover the cause, until she visits the gynecologist for a routine check-up. Then she learns it's something far worse than the flu.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mysterious computer crash pushed a thriving manufacturing company to the brink of collapse, jeopardizing hundreds of employees' jobs. Forensic investigators must determine if the crash was the result of a computer defect, human error, or sabotage.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bruce Miller was shot to death in the office of the junkyard business he owned. The crime scene was almost pristine. When a computer forensics expert examined the computers owned by the victim's wife and her lover, he found all the evidence needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. The tooth's filling contains unique properties that help investigators identify her remains. Further forensic evidence is then used to convict Donald Blom of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors cannot pinpoint the source of a businessman's illness.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was supposed to be a routine motorcade for the Queen of England. But on the way to Yosemite National Park, a car carrying three Secret Service agents collided with a car driven by a deputy from the local sheriff's office.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Armed with little else, police hoped the shoe impressions found at a Lansing, Michigan crime scene would put their investigation of Audrey Nichols' murder back on track.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 19-year-old woman was found dead in her car; the scene had been staged to make murder appear to be suicide. During their investigation, police discovered the victim was involved in a love quadrangle, giving several people a motive to kill her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: 1984 Rajneeshee bioterror attack: investigators uncover a plot to overthrow the government after a unique strain of salmonella makes people ill.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Native American woman was brutally killed in the desert of New Mexico, and the crime scene was rich in forensic evidence: tire tracks, shoe impressions and even the murder weapons.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man is found dead in his home, and his ex-wife has a perfect alibi. To determine time of death, investigators need to know when the victim ate his last meal. An endocrinologist, a forensic botanist, and a short-order cook answer their question.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Emergency dispatch received a call from a man who said his girlfriend shot and killed herself. The autopsy revealed that the gunshot wound was not self-inflicted and the evidence on her body would give police a golden opportunity to catch her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A married couple decided to escape the cold of winter with a mini-vacation in Key West. The wife went missing, and police searched every square inch of the island; they found nothing but a pair of sandals which might have belonged to her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide _ but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientists solved a 1992 murder case involving cremation. It takes a long time and a very hot fire to cremate a human body, and thus destroy evidence of foul play. But the coroner who performed the autopsy on the body found telltale clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In Pennsylvania 1984, a passer-by finds the torso of a woman in a cardboard box. Investigators rely on insect activity analysis by a forensic entomologist to determine when the murder victim was killed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the 2002 DC area shooting spree that resulted in ten murders.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Time of death becomes pivotal after a pregnant woman is found murdered in her air-conditioned bedroom. A striking similarity between her death and an HBO movie gives examiners the clues they need to thaw out the alibi of a cold-blooded killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An employee of a dry cleaner was raped and murdered in the store. Police turned to forensic science for the answers they needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an 11-year-old girl disappeared from a small town in a remote area of Alaska, investigators wondered if she'd been attacked by a bear or become lost in the dense woods. It turned out neither was true.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young couple decided to celebrate their first wedding anniversary with a camping trip to Mount Hood. During the trip, the husband was shot and killed, and his wife told two different versions of the events which led to his death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A union official is executed in his home not long after a strike by the union membership. Neither his wife nor anyone in the neighborhood heard any gunshots. It would take a forensic sound test, an electron microscope, and a nightgown to explain why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, a high school girl vanishes after attending a party. The prime suspect had not one but two alibi witnesses for the night she disappeared. A solid alibi can often overcome much circumstantial evidence. But forensic evidence is another matter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind _ tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brilliant young architect became ill and died just before she was to testify in a criminal trial. The autopsy revealed she'd been poisoned with arsenic. Investigators had to determine which person who knew her had a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For six years, a serial killer prowled the streets of New York City. He wrote letters to police and The New York Post, indicating he would kill twelve people, one for each astrological sign.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Relates the story of Paul Kenneth Keller, a serial arsonist responsible for several fires that caused millions of dollars worth of property damage and the deaths of three people. programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A go-go dancer told her family she needed to get away for a while, and then she simply disappeared. Investigators were suspicious, because she took neither her car nor her clothes. 20 years later, her family received a call that changed everything.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: A masked gunman surprises a woman and her lover in bed. After a burst of gunfire leaves the lover dead, the woman says she can ID the disguised gunman. Detectives hope phone records can prove her right.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: In a whirlwind romance, a beautiful college student falls under the spell of a local bad boy. He enourages her to help him with his criminal activities, and out of love she agrees. But when the two find themselves in an intense moment of danger, she quickly throws her morals away to protect her man.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When a teenage girl meets a handsome, charming older man, she feels like everything in her life is falling into place. But soon, a gruesome discovery related to the disappearance of a local woman will reveal a darker side to this love story. Before long, police are on the trail of a teen who would go to any lengths to be with her man.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When a God-fearing woman falls in love with a handsome ex-convict, he convinces her that his life of crime is behind him; he ropes her into helping him commit a double homicide, and she realizes she's in love with a wolf in sheep's clothing.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: A young woman is swept off her feet by a flashy, older man who lavishes her with attention and gifts, but soon learns her new man is actually the kingpin of a massive interstate drug operation.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When an up-and-coming rapper is killed in a hit-and-run in East Chicago, Indiana, police suspect jealousy fueled the crime. The victim had multiple women in his life, but detectives soon realize the killer will do anything to get away with murder.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When the bound body of a missing man is recovered from the river, foul play is immediately obvious. Detectives quickly uncover a dangerous love triangle, hidden bloodstains, and an informant who will bring the sick truth to light.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: After working together a few years, Quinn and Velazquez are chosen to take on the case of Apriel Allen, a woman who was murdered in her apartment two years prior. The detectives start over with a clean slate and hope to bring some peace to the family and friends of Allen.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: The gruesome murder of a young mother who was stabbed at least 80 times tells investigators that this slaying is personal; after eliminating the men in the victim's life, police discover a plot for revenge that can only be described as true evil.

programme.desc: The double murder of eccentric widow, Isobel Hewitt, and adulterous doctor, Duncan Goff, lead Barnaby and Troy into finding out more about their personal and private lives in the village of Malham Bridge. While Troy suspects an antique dealer that Isobel befriended is the culprit, Barnaby is not convinced, believing anyone the victims knew when they were alive could have been the murderer, from the doctor's wife to the local owner of a restaurant. Even Isobel's close family and members of a local fly fishing group are suspects as they investigate all possible angles.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce is taking part in an open-air art class, being held on the village green of Midsomer Florey, when she discovers the body of an elderly fellow student, Ruth Fairfax, concealed beneath some undergrowth shortly after a session. Just as Barnaby begins to learn that Ruth was not all she seemed to be, officers of the NIS pull him off the case. While Troy is allowed to assist them, Barnaby is left handling a local operation into a spate of thefts, yet he decides to continue his investigations in secret. In doing so, he soon turns up armed robbery, unaccounted stolen money, former criminals, and secret liaisons, before discovering that the NIS investigation is not being as thorough as it should be.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At his family home in Upper Warden, arrogant actor Larry Smith is killed, when a summer house he walks in to as part of a promotion for the sequel to his hit film, The House of Satan, is suddenly destroyed in an explosion. His family quickly fling accusations for his murder directly at the residents of rival village, Lower Warden, leading Barnaby and Troy to determine if this is the case, especially when Larry's director, another member of the family, is electrocuted while using an exercise bike. It's not long before secrets, affairs and blackmail begin to surface from within the two villages.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

While there was evidence he was desperately seeking to avoid bankruptcy, and had visited a local millionaire to get back his money from a scheme he had invested in, a post mortem reveals that he had been murdered. The two detectives soon find their investigations crossing over, when a man found to have an illegal collection of bird eggs, is also murdered, prompting concerns that the millionaire's scheme is being used to defraud many, and that someone is willing to kill to keep the scheme going.

programme.desc: Determined to prove Ethan's innocence, Emma takes matters into her own hands, with the help of Mads and Thayer (CHRISTIAN ALEXANDER).

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Arrested on murder charges, Ethan sits in jail as his friends search to prove his innocence. Dan (TYLER CHRISTOPHER) reaches out to an ex-girlfriend who is now a defense attorney.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Thayer (CHRISTIAN ALEXANDER) starts to doubt Alec's (ADRIAN PASDAR) alibi and begins investigating Rebecca's (CHARISMA CARPENTER) past. Meanwhile, Ethan is avoiding Emma.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: In the explosive season finale, Sutton encourages Emma to show Kristin what they found in Rebecca's (CHARISMA CARPENTER) house, and Ethan makes a discovery that changes the game.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: In the season premiere, Alec (ADRIAN PASDAR) is in jail after his arrest for murder, but he still manages to unnerve Emma. Rebecca and Sutton formulate plans for the Mercer family.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Sutton steps up her plans to win back Ethan. Feeling left out of Emma and Thayer's (CHRISTIAN ALEXANDER) growing closeness, Mads shocks Emma with a family revelation.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Sutton decides she wants her life back in order to spend more time with Ethan, and Laurel asks Jordan (recurring guest star RYAN ROTTMAN) out on a very awkward date.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Rebecca uses Sutton to further her agenda, and Emma learns that Sutton may not have told her the whole story about the night her car went in the lake.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Laurel begins asking questions about Sutton's radical personality changes and Emma renews her search for her birth mother.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: The school formal creates new opportunities for secrets and lies to be revealed when everyone ends up with the wrong partner. Emma turns to Ethan for help.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Emma struggles to make sense of newfound revelations and shifts in her relationships with Ethan and Thayer (CHRISTIAN ALEXANDER). Sutton and Rebecca's bond may start to crack.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Everyone gathers to celebrate the wedding of Dan (TYLER CHRISTOPHER) and Theresa (YARA MARTINEZ), but the celebration does not go off as planned. Ethan confronts Emma.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Ethan's confession to Dan (TYLER CHRISTOPHER) threatens their relationship. Sutton gets a phone call that may provide valuable information. Emma's feelings for Thayer are tested.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: In the season finale, growing suspicions have everyone on edge. Dan (TYLER CHRISTOPHER) gives Ethan an ultimatum with heartbreaking consequences and Emma finally confronts Rebecca.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Smart and quirky Megan Smith (JoANNA GARCIA) is offered a job as the live-in tutor of beautiful and rebellious twin teen millionaires in Palm Beach, Florida.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: When Laurel points Megan's sister, Lily, as being inappropriately dressed at a glamorous social event, Megan lies to Laurel about knowing her. Megan and Sage argue over Rose.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan meets with Rose's headmaster, Jacob Cassidy (recurring guest star DAVID GIUNTOLI), and is disarmed by his age and good looks. Plus, the twins skip tutoring for a yacht party.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan gets too much information about the twins' sex lives, and her own insecurities show up during a date with Jacob (recurring guest star DAVID GIUNTOLI).

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan is forced to cancel her plans for a spa weekend with Jacob (recurring guest star DAVID GIUNTOLI) when Laurel demands she act as chaperone for Rose and Sage's pool party.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: A photo shoot with Rose and Sage for Laurel's upcoming marketing campaign with top photographer Rocco Zaretti (guest star NIGEL BARKER - "America's Next Top Model") is a disaster.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan reconnects with her estranged father (guest star JOHN ALLEN NELSON - "24") and asks Marco to prepare dinner for two at the estate. Lily, Will, Rose and Sage also show up.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan learns a secret about Laurel's past. Sage meets with publicist Patricia Kingston (guest star KATHY NAJIMY - "Numb3rs"), but she is only interested if Rose is also involved.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: The twins encounter blogger PEREZ HILTON on the red carpet at a club and SARAH DREW ("Everwood") guest stars as Megan's best friend from Yale, Caryn.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan has a great date with Will but can't deal with the fact that he is also dating other women. When Rose gets a bad grade on an exam, she decides to cheat on her next test.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Will and Megan's new romance is threatened when Will plans to accept a job in Brazil. Sage "tortures" Charlie's cousin, Luis (IGNACIO SERRICCHIO), who gets a job in the kitchen.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan's mother, Shelby (guest star SHARON LAWRENCE - "NYPD Blue"), who abandoned the family when Megan was a child, returns. Will is jealous when Megan turns to Charlie for advice.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan confronts her mother, Shelby (SHARON LAWRENCE), Rose and Sage throw an elaborate charity dinner and Marco's boyfriend, Keith (DAVID MONAHAN), pushes Marco to quit his job.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan wants Lily out of jail, but her father (JOHN ALLEN NELSON) thinks Lily should be left there to learn a lesson. Shelby (SHARON LAWRENCE) later asks Will for the bail money.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Rose's boyfriend, Zach (DAVID FRANCO), gets upset after seeing a picture of Rose and Sage with bassist PETE WENTZ of the band Fallout Boy. Megan meets Will's parents.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Charlie surprises Megan by admitting he has been in love with her for years. Will reacts badly to the news. And Rose gets some surprising news of her own.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: The twins confront Laurel with their shocking news. Rose knows Sage is keeping something from her and when Sage finally confesses her secret, it changes their relationship.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: KATHY GRIFFIN appears as Keith (DAVID MONOHAN) and Marco's wedding planner. Megan and Will fight and break up, leaving Megan solo at the wedding. But does she leave solo?

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: In the series premiere, when a series of vampire-style murders plagues Los Angeles, Mick sets out to find the culprits, and reconnects with Beth.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: When a convicted murderer who knows Mick's secret is released from prison, Mick fears Beth will find out.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: Still reeling from Mick's revelation about his identity, a cautious Beth struggles as she helps him track down a newly turned vampire who doesn't know how to control his bloodlust.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: Mick gets injured while searching for a woman in the desert. As the sunlight depletes Mick's vampiric ability to heal himself, Beth must rush to take measures to save his life.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: Mick hunts a teenage vampire who is preying on female escorts he locates via the Internet. Meanwhile, Mick and Beth try to avoid each other after sharing an intimate moment.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: Mick searches for a mysterious vampire from Josef's past. Meanwhile, Beth investigates when a model overdoses and dies. When the two cases intersect, Mick and Beth work together.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: Mick experiences déjà vu while investigating a fire that is eerily similar to the one that killed his ex-wife, Coraline.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: Mick protects a frightened woman from the cult followers of a killer after they vow to avenge their leader's dying wish that those responsible for his execution be put to death.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: Beth feels slighted and jealous when Mick begins working closely on a case with a mysterious photographer who resembles his ex-wife.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: When a dying man with a long-standing vendetta puts a hit out on Josef, Mick discovers the real reason Josef believes Mick and Beth can never work.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: Mick and Beth must work together when a vindictive drug lord kidnaps Josh and his fate lies in their hands.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: Mick's dream of becoming human again is within reach when he uncovers Coraline's secret. Still angry with Mick, Beth must deal with some heartbreaking news alone.

programme.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: In a volatile and unpredictable world, the show will be the definitive guide for the global news audience to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day. With news making executives, officials and thought-leaders from the world of business, politics and academia we will explore a story through probing interviews and nuanced conversations. The hour of programming will also highlight the most relevant stories from India which is currently one of the hottest investment destinations, but also has compelling stories that play into the Bloomberg's priority issues such as Climate change, Diversity and Technological innovation.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: A spotlight on the fast paced growth and major deals happening across the Middle East and Africa. Linking the market drivers from overnight in the US and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep dive analysis of the top business, energy and geopolitical stories shaping the decisions of traders across the Middle East, Africa and beyond.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe

programme.title: Acábame de matar
programme.desc: Un oficial de policía está desahuciado y espera la muerte con orgullo, por eso contrata a un hombre para que lo aniquile.

programme.title: La tierra prometida
programme.desc: Historia bíblica que sigue a Josué mientras lidera a los hebreos hacia Canaán. Josué enfrenta diversos desafíos, incluyendo la oposición de Samara, quien está enamorada de él.

programme.title: La hoguera de la ambición
programme.desc: Una familia adinerada se desmorona cuando sus miembros comienzan una furiosa batalla por el reparto de sus riquezas.

programme.title: Génesis
programme.desc: El faraón padece una extraña enfermedad en la piel y se entera de que Saraí es esposa de Abraham. Saraí le informa a su esposo que el faraón ya sabe la verdad y que seguramente deberán partir. Un asesinato se lleva a cabo en silencio.

programme.title: Señora del Destino
programme.desc: Maria do Carmo es una madre de cinco hijos que triunfó en la vida con mucha lucha y tesón pero que todavía tendrá una batalla que luchar: obtener el cariño de su hija quien fue secuestrada cuando era una recién nacida.

programme.title: Jesus
programme.desc: La trayectoria de Jesucristo antes de la resurrección. Sus milagros y el calvario de la cruz. Las vidas de quienes fueron curados por Jesucristo y quiénes eran los apóstoles.

programme.title: Hijos del Monte
programme.desc: Cinco hermanos viven una vida tranquila en el fundo Rinconada del Monte, encargándose de cuidar del próspero fundo, legado de su padres, pero todo cambia cuando se lee el testamento, iniciándose una ruptura y el inicio de una nueva historia.
